p: Improvements in ART quality and availability mean people infected with HIV can now live almost normal lives. This also means that the number of people living with HIV is going to increase. One of the most crucial ways of combatting the epidemic will be to maintain a reduction in the number of new infections. In this sense, we are on the right track as new infections have fallen by 35% since 2000, from 3.1 million people in 2000 to 2 million in 2014 (UNAIDS 2015).
